content.description: Start as for Catapult, pull on to the shelf and tend right along the line of jugs. Using heel and toe hooks move through a break in the jugs to a new shelf. From here, readjust feet and move up and right through big shelves and ledges to get to the top of the boulder, just left of the right arete.
content.location: Same start as Catapult. Several feet to the right of Slingshot, on the front face of the overhangs boulder. Starts on the large head height shelf and trends right towards the overhang at the right arete of this face.

content.description: Start on 2 incuts at waist height and work left to a jug and make big move to lip and topout. Left of the buttcrack project start
content.location: if facing buttcrack, starting holds are to the left

content.description: Start somewhere under the overhang with aretes on both sides and finish straight up. will require some flexibility as well impressive use of flat geometric edges with no features
Start sitting on rounded mini jugs on right arete of overhang and finish straight up using crimps and slab technique. Labeled as "Wet Dream" in beta photo
Sit start with hands matched on a 1/2 pad edge and feet on thin edges out to the right. Pull on (crux) and punch up to the jug and then an easy finish straight up as for Trebuchet.
content.location: On the front of the Overhangs Boulder, just left of the overhanging prow and ~10' to the right of Slingshot/Catapult.

content.description: Start on the large shelf at about head height, several feet to the right of slingshot. Pull on to the shelf, hike feet up and climb straight up to the next shelf and top out.
content.location: On the front face of the Overhangs boulder. Starts on the large shelf that runs at head height along the right side of that face in the direction of the overhang project. This shelf is 4/5' to the right of Slingshot.

content.description: Start inside deep crack of wall (the buttcrack) and link into Sling Shot using flat edges and contortions/kneebar moves..... cool
Start sitting and climb the right arete using a cool ear/horn feature up high. topout at apex of overhang .....classic!!
content.protection: multiple pads and a good spotter

content.description: Match hands on undercling, stick a left foot on the edge in the middle of the roof, pull on and make one thrutchy move up and slightly left to a good hold, don't fall, match up and then bump up to good juggy holds for an easy finish after the first move. We needed ~15" of foam to be able to pull off the ground for the first move. The landing is also not great so it is very helpful to have a lot of pads and someone to move them around as needed.
content.location: Located on the front of the Overhang boulder, in the same location as the "Overhang Project"

content.description: This area includes a wall about 12 ft tall and 20 yards long that ends in a cool blocky overhang with aretes on both sides.
